modules.description: Provides asynchronous I/O operations and event loop management using Lwt, with support for socket communication and non-blocking file handling. Works with Lwt's thread-like constructs, promises, and Picos' event-driven architecture. Enables real-time data processing and networked applications with cooperative multitasking.

Provides functions to execute OCaml code as Lwt fibers or promises, using Lwt_unix for system operations. Works with Picos.Fiber.t and Lwt.t types to manage asynchronous execution and cancellation. Enables running main programs as fibers, capturing results, and controlling cancellation propagation in a direct style.

Provides functions for managing asynchronous delays, thread-safe signaling, and waiting for signals. Operates with `float` for sleep durations and `trigger` objects for synchronization. Used to coordinate tasks across threads, implement timeouts, and manage event-driven workflows in Lwt-based applications.
